thread.title: Maple Leafs’ Morgan Rielly leaves game with injury, will not return
thread.title_full: Maple Leafs’ Morgan Rielly leaves game with injury, will not return

author: Callum Ferguson
title: Maple Leafs’ Morgan Rielly leaves game with injury, will not return
text:
Presented by: Maple Leafs’ Morgan Rielly leaves game with injury, will not return 
Morgan Rielly got tangled up with William Carrier and hit the boards awkwardly, forcing him to leave for the dressing room during the first period of action.  35 PM Callum Ferguson  35 PM 
Toronto Maple Leafs defenceman Morgan Rielly left Tuesday’s game against the Buffalo Sabres with an apparent lower-body injury and will not return. . @MapleLeafs defenceman Morgan Rielly (lower body injury) will not return to tonight's game. #TMLtalk 
— Leafs PR (@LeafsPR) January 18, 2017 
The 22-year-old suffered the injury in the first period when he collided with Sabres winger William Carrier, falling awkwardly into the boards. 
After initially heading to the dressing room, Rielly would return for just one shift, appearing to be in some discomfort before leaving the game for good. Jake Gardiner now skating in Rielly's spot with Nikita Zaitsev. 
— Chris Johnston (@reporterchris) January 18, 2017 
The Vancouver native has 17 points (one goal, 16 assists) in all 41 games for the Leafs this season while averaging nearly 23 minutes of ice time per game. “It’s a huge loss, obviously. He played 27 minutes for us last game…. Hopefully we’ll see him back." —Matt Hunwick on Morgan Rielly 
— luke fox (@lukefoxjukebox) January 18, 2017 
Rielly has remained healthy throughout his NHL career, but suffered an ACL tear in his right knee while playing Junior, causing him to miss almost all of his draft year (2011-12) while playing for the WHL's Moose Jaw Warriors. %2Fhockey%2Fnhl%2Fmaple-leafs-morgan-rielly-leaves-game-injury-will-not-return%2F
